meanings.def: the soft substance between the skin and bones of animal or human bodies
examples: The trap had cut deeply into the rabbit's flesh.
Tigers are flesh-eating animals.
the smell of rotting flesh
African hunting dogs will tear at the flesh of their victim until it is weak.
Babies are born not just as bundles of flesh and bone but with already distinctive personalities.
Cook the duck until the juices run pale yellow when the flesh is pierced.
Falcons usually strip the flesh off their prey.
The injury was only a flesh wound and would heal in ten days or so.
The knife cut through flesh and bone.
The weapon tore into his flesh.

meanings.def: the skin of the human body
examples: His fingers closed around the soft flesh of her arm.
flesh-coloured (= a light brownish pink colour)
My flesh tingled as I got out of the ice cold pool.
His shirt was too small for him and cut into the tender flesh at his armpit.
The tights come in various flesh tones.

meanings.def: the soft part of fruit and vegetables, especially when it is eaten
examples: the sweet flesh of a mango
Cut the melon in half and scoop out the flesh.

meanings.def: the human body when considering its physical and sexual needs, rather than the mind or soul
examples: the pleasures/sins of the flesh
His moral sermons always denounced the lusts of the flesh.

meanings.def: when you say that somebody is flesh and blood, you mean that they are a normal human with needs, emotions and weaknesses
examples: Listening to the cries was more than flesh and blood could stand.
She wasn't a ghost. She was flesh and blood.

meanings.def: a person that you are related to
examples: You can’t do that to your own flesh and blood!

meanings.def: if you see somebody in the flesh, you are in the same place as them and actually see them rather than just seeing a picture of them
examples: Thousands of fans gathered to see the band in the flesh.

meanings.def: to make you feel afraid or full of horror
examples: Just the sight of him makes my flesh creep.
The story made his flesh creep.

meanings.def: the full amount that somebody owes you, even if this will cause them trouble or difficulty
examples: You’re determined to have your pound of flesh, aren’t you?

meanings.def: to say hello to people by shaking hands
to develop a basic idea, etc. by giving more details to make it more complete
examples: The strength of the book is that it puts flesh on the bare bones of this argument.

meanings.def: you intend to do good things but you are too lazy, weak or busy to actually do them
a person or thing that repeatedly annoys somebody or stops them from doing something
